gmmaker > gameAudio

gameAudio 

interface gameAudio

Methods that allow the mode to play and stop sounds.

Summary

Methods from gameAudio

void
playSound(id: string, volume: number, panning: number)

Play a sound with a specified volume and panning.
void
playSoundAtWorldPos(id: string, volume: number, xPos: number)

Play a sound with a specified volume at a specified X position in the world.
void
stopAllSounds()

Stop ALL sounds that are currently playing, including sounds made by bonk.io itself.

Public Methods

playSound gmm.d.ts:1337 
playSound(id: string, volume: number, panning: number) → {void}

Play a sound with a specified volume and panning.

The ID corresponding to a custom sound can be changed in the Mode Settings menu. You can find a list with all of the vanilla sounds and their respective IDs here.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id string

The ID of the sound to play.
volume number

Volume of the sound (0 to 1). You can play sounds with volumes higher than 1.
panning number

Panning (balance) of the sound (-1 to 1).
Returns:
Type Description
void
playSoundAtWorldPos gmm.d.ts:1347 
playSoundAtWorldPos(id: string, volume: number, xPos: number) → {void}

Play a sound with a specified volume at a specified X position in the world.

The ID corresponding to a custom sound can be changed in the Mode Settings menu. You can find a list with all of the vanilla sounds and their respective IDs here.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id string

The ID of the sound to play.
volume number

Volume of the sound (0 to 1). You can play sounds with volumes higher than 1.
xPos number

World X position of the sound.
Returns:
Type Description
void
stopAllSounds gmm.d.ts:1357 
stopAllSounds() → {void}

Stop ALL sounds that are currently playing, including sounds made by bonk.io itself.

Returns:
Type Description
void
